lines.speaker: phoebe

lines.speaker: monica

lines.speaker: phoebe

lines.speaker: monica

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Oh my God!Eh! Well

lines.text: In case you havent heard, Courteney Cox got married to David Arquette during hiatus and changed her name to Courteney Cox Arquette. But David was a busy boy during the off season for not only did he marry but everyone else as well. For theyre all listed as Jennifer Aniston Arquette, Lisa Kudrow Arquette, in an interesting twist Matt LeBlanc Arquette, Matthew Perry Arquette, David Schwimmer Arquette, and even the creators of the show are now David Crane Arquette and Marta Kauffman Arquette. I just wonder what the new sleeping arrangements are }

lines.speaker: rachel

lines.speaker: ross

lines.text: Mornin Pheebs.  Well, my movie has officially been canceled.

lines.text: I dont know, its such a long trip.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Itll be great! We-we could talk, and play games! Huh? This could be our chance to like renew our friendship.

lines.text: Are you asking me to have a frenaissance?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: All right. Although I dont think we need one, I never stopped loving you.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Hey.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Hey.

lines.text: So, has anyone talked to Dr. and Mrs. Geller yet?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Um-hmm, yeah. They left me a message; they should be here any minute.

lines.text: Where is the waitress?! Im starving!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Its a buffet man.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Oh, heres where I win all my money back!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Listen, I gotta talk to you.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Sure! Whats up?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Monica and I almost got married last night.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Oh my God! Thats huge!  Wait a minute, why come I wasnt invited? And who was going to be your best man? Dont say, "Ross." Do not say, "Ross."

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Look, I just dont think Monica and I are ready to get married yet! Yknow? I mean, I love her and everything but seeing Ross and Rachel coming out of that chapel was like a, like a wake-up call that Monica and I are moving so fast. Yknow? And, how do I tell her without crushing her?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Oh! Tell her shes not marriage material.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: What?!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Girls say it to me all the time! And believe me, if shes anything like me, shes just gonna be relieved.

lines.text: How do I tell Chandler that its too soon. Its gonna break his heart, hes not gonna think that I dont love him anymore.

lines.speaker: phoebe

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Yes I do!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Good! Good! I was just testing you.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Hi.

lines.speaker: monica

lines.text: Hey!

lines.text: Are we gonna talk about what you guys did last night? Or

lines.text: Yeah!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: No, we didnt get married! Thats ridiculous!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: We-we-weI remember being in a chapel.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh my God.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: IThey would not let us get married when we were that drunk!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: No!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: What are you guys gonna do?

lines.text: Well, I guess we just find a divorce lawyer?

lines.text: Well, I think, I think, Ross already has one. Now, this ones free, right? Because you paid for the first two, so the third ones free.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Laugh it up, but the jokes on you. Because we dont need to get divorced, okay? We were just gonna get an annulment.

lines.text: Youre thing. Youre thing. Yknow? Youre the guy who gets divorced.

lines.speaker: all

lines.text: No-no, thats-thats not my thing! I do not love getting divorced!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Yes you do! This is your third divorce! You love divorce so much youre probably gonna marry it! Then it wont work out and youre gonna have to divorce it, divorcing guy.  Im so drunk.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: So where are we on the whole going back to the place where they have all the marriages thing? I love you.

lines.speaker: monica

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Yes, we dont get married unless theres a sign! Okay, so say uh, say you roll another eight  then theres a definite sign that we should get married.

lines.text: Ohh, okay, Im sorry. Youre right. Yknow what? We absolutely can stay married, because I was under the impression that the boxes were far away from each other. All right, look, just please, take a moment here and think about what youre asking of me.

lines.text: Come on Pheebs! I cant take this anymore! Let-let me make it up to you. Huh?  Ground control to Major Tom. Commencing countdown, engines on. Take your protein pills and put your helmet on!

lines.text: Pheebs, I am so sorry! I know I promised you a fun road trip with your friend and I didnt deliver. But-but-but now I know that you think being awake is an important part of friendship! So, so, so I will strive to-to stay awake for as long as I know you.

lines.text: You can still sleep at night and stuff.

lines.text: All right, should we just, should we just get married? Yknow? I mean should we just do it? All the signs are telling us to do it.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: No!

lines.speaker: chandler

lines.speaker: monica

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Okay.

lines.speaker: monica

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Its an old key!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Oh my God its old!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: I love you!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: I love you!

lines.text: No.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Oh, yeah, no problems. Its all taken care of.

lines.speaker: rachel

lines.text: Oh yeah, why not?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Pheebs?

lines.text: Okay, umm, Im gonna get my sweater.

lines.speaker: ross

lines.text: What?!

lines.text: What are you doing?

lines.text: I can fix it. Hold on.  Look out. Look out.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: It still doesnt work.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Im not finished.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Oh.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Nice job Joe! Youre quite the craftsmen.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Hey!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Hey, so did everything go okay with the annulment?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Oh, yeah, no problems. Its all taken care of.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Ross, thank you. Hey, do you guys wanna go see a movie?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Oh yeah, why not?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Okay, umm, Im gonna get my sweater.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Okay.  You uh, you wanna hear something weird?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Always.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: I didnt get the annulment.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: What?!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Were still married! Dont tell Rachel. See you later.

lines.text: Hey, do you have any gum?

lines.text: Oh? Yeah! Sure!

lines.speaker: phoebe

lines.text: Yeah, were, were actually just gonna walk cause its right up there at the Angelica.

lines.text: Ross?!

lines.text: Well, I tried! But when I got to my lawyers office all I could hear was, "Three divorces. Three divorces!" Look, I just dont want my tombstone to read, Ross Gellar, Three Divorces.

lines.speaker: phoebe

Third marriage, well they really shouldnt allow you to get married when youre that drunk and have writing all over your face, Nevadas fault.

lines.text: No.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Of course not, because youre in love with her.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: I am not in love with her. She was very upset about having to move out so I eh, didnt tell her we were still married because she would only get more upset. I-I just comforted her, as a friend.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: What do you mean, comforted her?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Its nothing, I just gave her a hug.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Ah-ha! A classic sign of love, the hug!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Its also a sign of friendship.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Yeah, not in your case Lovey Loverson.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: It was a hug!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Okay, just tell me this, did you or did you not smell her hair?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: S-s-smell her hair? What if I did?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Ninety percent of a womens pheromones come out the top of her head! Thats why, thats why women are shorter. So that men will fall in love when they hug them!  Oh come on Ross, youre a scientist.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: I was hugging her as a friend. Its not my fault her-her hair got in my face, shes got a lot of it and it smells all-all uh coconutty.  What?! Oh, that doesnt mean I have feelings for Rachel! Maybe it means I have feelings for coconuts!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Okay, whatever you say. But just be careful, all right? Rachels not in the same place you are.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: If the place you are referring too is being in love, then she is in the same place as me because I am not in that place!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Okay, I didnt understand that, but yknow, maybe thats cause you were speaking the secret language of love!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Hey!  Dude, some guy just called for you.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Who was it?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: I dont know! How about, "Thanks for taking the message." Jeez!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Okay listen, yknow when you move in Rachels room is gonna be empty, you wanna talk about what we want to do with it?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Sure!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Okay, I was thinking we should have a beautiful guest room, right? With a mahogany sleigh bed and bedside tables with flowers on them all the time! And we could have a roll top desk with comment cards on them so people could say how much they loved staying here!! Okay, whatever, I really havent thought about it that much.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Well, I like that idea. Obviously! I was thinking maybe-maybe-maybe it could be a game room, yknow? I mean you can buy old arcade games like uh, like Space Invaders and Asteroids for $200, the real ones! The big-big ones!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: No.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Okay so you mean no as in, "Gee Chandler, what an interesting idea. Lets discuss it before we reject it completely."

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Oh, Im sorry. Of course I mean that. Interesting idea, umm, talk about it, but no.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: So, thats it?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: I just dont think arcade games go in the beautiful guest room. The beautiful guest room is gonna be filled with antiques.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Which is why Asteroids is perfect! Its the oldest game!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: What do you have against the beautiful guest room?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: I dont have anything against the beautiful guest room, especially since everybody we know lives about 30 seconds away!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Are you mocking me?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: No, Im not mocking you,  or you beautiful guest room.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Hey, whats up?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Nothing, Monica and I had a stupid fight.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: But youre still moving in together, right? Because my ad came out today.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: "Wanted. Female roommate, non-smoker, non-ugly." Nice!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Yeah? I just figured yknow, after living with you itd be an interesting change of pace to have a female roommate, yknow? Someone I can learn from, someone-someone whos different than me. And whats more different than me; a guy whos not 19 than say a girl who is 19? Enh?  Not just a hat rack my friend!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Pheebs, I have to ask you

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Shhhhhh! Im swamped right now.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Youre just staring into space.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Umm, Im trying to move that pencil.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: This one?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: It worked!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Pheebs, this whole apartment thing is just a nightmare! Every place I can afford comes with a roommate who is a freak. I mean, look at this;  "Wanted. Female roommate, non-smoker, non- ugly." Its just, there is nothing! The citys full!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Wait, no, look at this!   "Two bedroom, two bath, must be non-smoker, Satan worshipers okay " Oh, yeah, but its on the ground floor.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Hey!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Hey.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Rach, uh, you still looking for a place?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Yeah! Why?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Okay, theres this guy, Warren, from the museum and hes going on a dig for like two years and hes got this great place he needs to sublet. So uh, you interested?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: That sounds great! Id love to live at Warrens!! I love Warren! Thank you!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Dont thank me! If you wanna thank something, thank the volcano that erupted thousands of years ago, killing but perfectly preserving an entire civilization.  Heres Warrens number.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh, this is great! I am gonna call him right now!  Oh, thank you!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Okay, you go grab it!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: I saw it.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: I dont know what youre talking about.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Umm, Im talking about that which you already know but wont admit. You love her again; you re-love her!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Look, I do not re-love her.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: I cant believe you wont just admit it!  Okay, just promise me that you wont do anything stupid.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Look, were just friends now! Okay? Why would I do anything stupid?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Ugh!!! Well, the apartment is already subletted! I mean, this is just hopeless. Im never gonna find anything.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: You can live with me.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: What?!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: What?!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: What?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh my God! Are you serious?!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Uh-huh.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: I would love to live with you Ross; thats-thats great! Thank you!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Well, Im-Im just glad I could, yknow, help you out.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Wow! Im-Im so happy for you guys.  This is so-so, not stupid.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Ross-Ross, you have no idea what this means to me! I mean, I mean I was gonna be homeless. You just saved me! Youre my hero!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Hero, I uh, I dont knowwell, all right.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh, I have to go tell Monica what a wonderful brother she has!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Oh please!   Youre gonna say things now, arent ya?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: No. No, I wont. But I should tell you this, this exact same thing happened to my roommate Denise. She moved in with a guy who was secretly married to her and he said he didnt love her, but he really did, and it just blew up! And thats how she ended up living with me!   Okay, thats a lie.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Hi.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Hi.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Hi, listen, Im sorry about before. I dont need to have a game room. I mean when I was a kid I only played those games because I couldnt get girls, and now I can emNow, I have you.  Not-not that I think that I have you or think of you as property in any sort of way, I see women

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Stop it Chandler.  Im sorry too.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Really?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Yeah! Oh yes!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Ohh.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Listen, we dont have to make that a guest room, we can think of something to do with the room together.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Thats a great idea! We can easily think of a way for us both to enjoy the room.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Totally!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: We dont have to come up with this now.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Oh good.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Hey, yknow what? Why dont we think about changes we can make in the living room?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Changes?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Yeah, I mean were gonna have to move around some furniture to make room for my chair.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Youre-youre-youre gonna bring the Barca Lounger over here?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Is that a problem?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Well, its a set and they should probably stay together.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Oh, thats cool. Then Ill just bring them both over.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: See now-now youre taking them away from their home.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Okay, I get it. So, I get nothing! Nothing here is mine! Everything here is yours! Ill get up in the morning put on your clothes, and head off to work!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Yeah-yeah, yknow what? Yeah, thats it-thats it, everything will be mine! Nothing will be yours! Thats-thats what I said! Oh come on, Chandler! Im talking about the barca lounger! It just, it doesnt match! Where is it gonna go?!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: In the game room!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Look it is not my fault that your chairs are incredibly ugly!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: All right! Thats fine! Thats fine! I wont bring over the chairs! I wont bring anything over! I wouldnt want to ruin the ambiance over here at Grandmas place!!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Everything on your application looks really goodOhh! Just one last question umm, are you and your friends gonna be over here all the time like partying and hanging out?

lines.speaker: the potential roommate
lines.text: Oh dont worry, Im not really a party girl.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Whoa!! Now look, dont be just blurtin stuff out. I want you to really think about your answers. Okay?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: You can call off the roommate search!  Hi! Ill be living here.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Oh dont listen to him, hes just some guy who really wants the apartment, but I dont think hes gonna get it.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Why did you take the shower curtain down?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: That thing was a hazard!  Im very safety conscious.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Hey!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Hey! Oh listen, I was just clearing some space for your stuff.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh thanks, but listen, I was just at Monicas and she and Chandler had a big fight and theyre not moving in.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: What do you mean, theyre not moving in? They-theyre still moving in right?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: No-no, they just had a big blowout over what to do with my room.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: What?! Over a stupid room!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Yeah, I feel kinda bad for them, but Im also really psyched cause I dont have to move in here!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Oh no, yeah no, that parts great!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Whats all this about you guys fighting?! Is this really over a room?! I mean, that is so silly!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Ross, we can handle this.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Well, apparently not, and I cant just stand by and watch two people I care about very much be hurt over something that is so silly. I mean, enough of the silliness!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Well, why dont you tell her to stop being silly!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Okay-okay! Two very good points, look Ive known you both a long time, and Ive never seen either of you one/millionth as happy as youve been since youve got together. Do you really want to throw that all away over a room? That is so silly. Now wh-what is more important, love or silliness?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Well, we are fond of the silliness, but we also have a soft spot for the love.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Love is the best medicine.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Thats laughter.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Why do you do it?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: I dont know.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Okay! All right! Now, Chandler you-you wanna live with Monica, right?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Yeah, I do.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: And Mon, you wanna live with Chandler, dont ya?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Yes.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Good! A verbal contract is binding in the state of New York!

lines.speaker: gunther
lines.text: So I understand youre looking for a place.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: No-no, Im staying put.

lines.speaker: gunther
lines.text: Oh, I was going to offer you my apartment.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Why, where are you going?

lines.speaker: gunther
lines.text: I dont know.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Hey Rach!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Hi!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Youre never gonna believe it uh, Monica and Chandler are moving in again. Thats great news rightI mean for them. Right?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh wow.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Yeah but, on the bright side, we get to be roommates again.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Yeah. Yknow umm, uh, umm, about that, umm, Ross I really appreciate your offer to let me move in and everything, but dont you think its gonna be weird?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Wh-why?! Why-why-why would it, why would it be weird?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Well, because of us! Because of our history.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: No!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: No?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: No! No! It would be weird if we were still in that place, I mean are you still in that place?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: No! Not at all!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Good! Me neither! So its not a problem. Were just two friends who happen to be roommates.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Okay, but Ross, eventually you and I are gonna be dating.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Really?! We are?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Yeah! Im gonna have a boyfriend, youre gonna have a girlfriend

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Ohh! That would be great.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: But yknow what, if you think its gonna be okay well just work out a system. Yknow, itll be like college, Ill hang a hanger on the door and put a sign, "Come back later, Im gettin lucky."

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Yeah, I didnt think of that.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: So are you sure about this whole moving in thing?! I mean its a really big step! And-and whats the rush?!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Thats very funny!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Hes being silly, because he knows that we enjoy the silliness!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: No, I-I-Im serious, okay? I mean, think about it. You move in, you start fighting over stupid game rooms, next thing yknow you break up!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Ross, you were right before, it was just a stupid fight about a room.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Okay, there are no stupid fights!! This isnt about the room, this is about what the room represents! And unfortunately, this room  could destroy you!!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Yeah, I'm not so worried.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Yeah, no, me neither.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Fine! Its your life!  I just dont want to see you guys break up! Which you will do if you move in together,  but thats what you want, theres nothing I can do.  DONT DO IT!!!!!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: You still want to move in together right?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Of course!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Ross didnt scare you?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Scared me out of ever wanting to live with him.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Come here, I want to show you something!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Okay!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Oh my God! Someones killed Square Man!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: This is where I thought the barca lounger could go! You see you could see the TV and its still walking distance to the kitchen.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Oh thats so sweet! I want to show you something too!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Okay!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Yknow those big-big uh, road signs that say "Merge?"

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Uh-hmm.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Yknow? So I was thinking that we could get one of those signs and hang it over our bed. Because, thats you and I together! Merge!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Oh my God! I love that!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Really?!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Uh, no!!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: I found you in my bed!                             Howd you whined up there?                              You are a mystery!                             Little black curly hair!                             Little black curly hair!                             Little black, little black, little black, little black, little black curly hair

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Now if you want to receive e-mails about my upcoming shows, then please give me money so I can buy a computer.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: So umm, where are the other guys?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Umm, well lets see Monica and Chandler are occupied.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Fighting?!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: No, the other thing. I really think its great they work things out.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Yeah. Theres no breaking them up, is there?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Hey, can I borrow the key to your house so I can run across the street and make a copy?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Sure! Here.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Thank you.  Now are you sure? Because once I make a copy, theres no turning back.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Yeah, Im-Im sure.  Yeah, get out of here before I change my mind.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Umm, listen, Ross do you really think this moving in with Rachel is a good idea?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Ive been back and forth.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Yeah well, maybe you should go back! Okay? Rachel moves in, and before you know it youre right where you dont want to be! Back together!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Ehh, I dont, I dont think so. Shes already talked about yknow, dating other guys.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Thats not gonna work out! Then shes gonna come home all weepy and youll be tellin her, "Oh thats okay. Youll find someone." And then, bamn! She finds you!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Yeah, well, m-maybe youre right.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: I am telling you Ross, she is definitely gonna fall in love with you again! Now, is that what you want?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Is that what I want?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Yes.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Here she comes. Hold on, Im gonna make your life much easier.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: All right, well the place was closed. Ill just copy it later.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Or not. Uh, Rach, why dont you just move in with me?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Whoa! Whoa! Whoa, Joey!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: No-no-no-no-no-no-no-no Its okay, I mean Ilook Rach, I know I scared you off with that whole Naked Thursdays thing, but we dont have to do that!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Well, it would be easier to move just right across the hall. Wait a minute, unless youre thinking about Naked Wednesdays.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Thursdays clearly not good for ya, pick a day!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Hi!

lines.speaker: the potential roommate
lines.text: Hi!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Come in. Thanks for comin back, umm, okay there have been a lot of people interested in the room, but I have narrowed it down and you are one of the finalists!

lines.speaker: the potential roommate
lines.text: Great!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Okay now, before I make my final decision I uh, I just want to make sure our personalities match. Okay, so I made up a little test. Now, Im gonna say a word and then you say the first thing that comes to mind.

lines.speaker: the potential roommate
lines.text: I can do that.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Okay! Here we go. Pillow.

lines.speaker: the potential roommate
lines.text: Fight.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Very good! Okay. G.

lines.speaker: the potential roommate
lines.text: String?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Excellent! Okay umm, doggy.

lines.speaker: the potential roommate
lines.text: Kitten?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Ooh, sorry! No-no-no, so close though, butbye-bye!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: So, which of this kitchen stuff is mine?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: This bottle opener.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: And?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: And its a magnet!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Look at that!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: How weird is that? Yknow? Youre moving in with me and have the one thing I dont have. Its like uh, in a way you-you complete me  kitchen.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: What?!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: You complete me kitchen, matey!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Ross, I know what youre thinking.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: What?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: That shes gonna move in with you and maybe then shell fall in love with you and then when she finds out youre already married, shell just be happy. Yknow? Youre just, youre very sad.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Oh my God! I-I see what this is! You are in love with Rachel!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: What?!!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Of course! It all adds up! I mean you youre obsessed with her. Its always, "Ross, what are you gonna do about Rachel?" "Ross, why-why are you moving in with Rachel?" "When are you gonna confess your secret marriage to Rachel?" You want her!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: No!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Uh-oh, saved by the bell.  Hello?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Hey Rach, arent these candlesticks  mine?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: No-no, I bought those.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Ohh! Yeah, I forgot.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: That youre a liar.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: No-no-no, thats great! Ill be there Monday. And thank you again!  Okay.   Umm, that was the head of the Paleontology department at N uh, Y, uh U!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Wow! Uh what, did he uh, say?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Well remember that paper I had published last year on sediment flow rate, huh? They loved it.

lines.text: Well theres an idea!!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Yeah!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: That would be great! Wait, how long is Denise gone for?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Umm, she said shed be back December 26th.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: December 26th, huh maybe shes Santa Clause.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh look who it is, my husband. The apple of my eye.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Okay, I got us a court date for tomorrow at 2:00 and I picked up all the forms. Ill take care of everything.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Well sure, if you say youre gonna take care of everything I have no reason to doubt you. Give me those forms!  All right, now Im gonna do this my way and I dont want to hear a peep out of you!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Okay Rach, but

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Op! Youre peeping!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Ross! Yknow what, I just gotwhy? Why did you do this?!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Look I told you

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: I dont wanna hear "Three failed marriages!"

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Look, if youd had two failed marriages, youd understand!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Well, yknow what? Thanks to you Im half way there! Ugh! Oh! I am so mad! Ross, I dont think I have ever been this angry!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: What about the time I said we were on a break?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Ugh!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Pheebs, hows it going?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Im doing okay. I think its going well. Do you think theyre having fun? Am I talking to fast?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Nope, sound like me. Pheebs, its going great. Look at Chandler with little baby girl Chandler.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Little baby girl Chandler, where I have heard that before? Oh right, Coach Ruben.  Do you know what Pheebs? When youre done over there, we kinda have a situation over here too.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Na-uh, no, we are all responsible for our own babies.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: See thats where I think that youre wrong. Weve been playing these babies man for man; we should really be playing a zone defense.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: What do you mean?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: I just think that things would go a lot smoother if we each have our own zone. Phoebe, you can be in charge of wiping. And yknow Mon, you can be in charge of diapering and I can be in charge of looking how cute they are when they put their hands around

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: That sounds really great, but maybe you should be in charge of wiping.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Okay, Im a rookie. I should not be in the end zone.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: This is so great! This is exactly how we set the plates at the restaurant.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Yeah?  Well this is not what I ordered.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Hey guys!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Hey!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Hey!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Hey babies! Oh, Im having the best morning. That uh, that Porsche Ive got the keys too, still there!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Shocking! Since you still have the keys.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: You should see the treatment I get when Im with that car! People are friendly; they-they wanna talk, and not just about the car! One guy gave me advice about my equity investments.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: What equity investments?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: The ones that got me the Porsche! Will you keep up!  But I figured, if-if people keep seeing me just standing there, theyre gonna start to think that I dont own it. So I figured Ill wash it. Right? Monica, you got a bucket and some soap I can borrow?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Oh yeah, I got soap and sponges and rags and Carnuba wax and polishing compound.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: You dont even have a car!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: I know. But umm, one time there was this really dirty car in front of the building, so I washed it.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: And?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: And six others.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: There you are.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Yeah, she tops out at 130.

lines.speaker: guy #2
lines.text: Wow!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: And thats just in the city. I get her up to 160 when I take her upstate.

lines.speaker: guy #2
lines.text: Really! You got a place upstate?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Sure!

lines.speaker: guy #2
lines.text: Well, Ill see you later.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Okay, take it easy.

lines.speaker: the porsche owner
lines.text: Hey! Thats my car.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Really? Oh uh, oh just give me five more minutes with it.

lines.speaker: the porsche owner
lines.text: What-what are you doing?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Oh I-I uh, found the keys and now Im just polishing her up.

lines.speaker: the porsche owner
lines.text: But its my car!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Yeah, but its my wax.

lines.speaker: the porsche owner
lines.text: Listen, I-I-I dont come to this city much so I dont know if youre crazy or this is some kind of street theater, but could I have my keys.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Sure. Here.  Ill uh, save your parking spot.

lines.speaker: the porsche owner
lines.text: Im not coming back.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Why not?

lines.speaker: the porsche owner
lines.text: I live upstate.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Yeah, so did I.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: I dont know why I was so nervous about this. And I dont know why Frank and Alice are always complaining. This is so easy.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Yeah, two hours, a lifetime thats the same.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Check it out! Check it out! When the babies wake up, they can meet Krog!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Chandler, what are you doing? That thing can put someones eye out!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: He can do more than that! He can destroy the universe!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: No Chandler, they can swallow one of those little parts! And also, look at his smooth area, thats just gonna mess them up.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Theyre not gonna swallow anything, you guys are being way over protective. When I was a kid, my mom used to just throw me into a pile of broken glass!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: What?!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Glass, sand, whatever.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Oh, look at little Leslie stretching in her sleep.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Oh its so cute. I wonder what age it is when you stop being able to put both legs over your head.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Oh, I can still do that.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: How are you still single?!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: All right.  I thought about it and maybe youre right. Maybe Krog is not a safe toy.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Good. What made you change your mind?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: I swallowed the sonic blaster gun.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: How did that happen?!!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Well, I was trying to prove that I was right. Yknow? And it turns out I was wrong. And now its lodged in my throat.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Damnit! Yknow this whole time we were concentrating on watching the babies and, and no one was watching Chandler!

lines.speaker: judge
lines.text: Okay you two are asking the court for an annulment?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Yes your honor, and here are, are forms, all filled out.

lines.speaker: judge
lines.text: So based on your petition you are seeking an annulment on the grounds that Mr. Geller is mentally unstable.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Fine, Im mentally unstable.

lines.speaker: judge
lines.text: And based on the fact that Mr. Geller is intravenous drug user.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: What?!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Uh yes, heroin and crack.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Crack isnt even an intravenous drug!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Well, you would know.

lines.speaker: judge
lines.text: Now it also says here that you lied about your sexual preference before marriage?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Oh, come on!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Ross, please, I found the magazines!

lines.speaker: judge
lines.text: And finally that you were unable to consummate the marriage. Well, that makes sense since youre gay and addicted to heroin.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Okay, Im sorry, this is insane! I-I-Im not addicted to heroin, Im not gay, and there is no problem with my ability to consummate anything! Look, Ill consummate this marriage right here, right now!

lines.speaker: judge
lines.text: That wont be necessary.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: And when we were dating we consummated like bunnies!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Ugh!

lines.speaker: judge
lines.text: Now if you were two involved in a serious relationship, that really creates a problem.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Ross! Your honor, rest assured relationship ended like two years ago!  And could you strike "Consummated like bunnies" from the record?

lines.speaker: judge
lines.text: Is there, anything in this record that is actually true?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Well, yes, we got married in Vegas and uh, and the names I think.

lines.speaker: judge
lines.text: Well, based on what I heard, you two certainly dont qualify for an annulment. If you two dont want to be together youll have to file for divorce.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Thats great! Are you happy now? Look what you did with your funny, funny form!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: What?! Me?! What about you and your consummated like bunnies nonsense!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: And whatWhat are you typing that for? Did you hear what she said? We dont get the annulment. Dont type that! What?! Stop typing!  Hey! Stop typing!  Stop typing! Stop typing!!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Okay, do you see, do you see what youre keeping me married too?!

lines.speaker: judge
lines.text: You need to get out of my chambers.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: All right look lady here is the deal, I came here for an annulment and I am not leaving here until I get one!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Yeah!

lines.speaker: judge
lines.text: Would you like to spend the night in jail?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: And thank you for your time.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: So the Porsche guy took his car back.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: But you found the keys to his clothes?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: No. No, I just uh, I just loved the way it feels when everybody thinks I own a Porsche.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: And people will think you own a Porsche because youre wearing the clothes?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Of course! Only an idiot would wear this stuff if you didnt have the car! Right?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: That is true.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Yeah, but only a genius would swallow a sonic blaster gun.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Oh, Ive been there. Yeah, I am gonna go drive my Porsche.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Joey, you know you dont actually have one.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Come on! What are you doing?! Im in character! Would you talk to her!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Ahh, I think it just moved. Its really poking me.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: All right, thats it, were going to the emergency room.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: What?! No, you cant, you cant leave me here with them! Were baby- sitting!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: The babies are asleep, Im sure youll be okay on your own for a while!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: But you-you cant leave me with them! We-were a team! Were playing a zone! Theyre gonna triple team me!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Hes got something plastic lodged in his throat, weve got to go to the hospital.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: But no, because a doctor wont be able to help him, its just gonna yknow naturally pass through his system in like seven years.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: I think thats gum.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Im pretty sure its gun.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Okay, listen this really hurts. Lets go.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: A real man wouldnt just run to the hospital!  No! What would, what would Krog do?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Why isnt that valet back with my Porsche?

lines.speaker: passerby
lines.text: Maybe because youve got the keys?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Porsche.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: This is totally your fault!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: My fault?! You threatened the judge!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Well, you ripped the paper out of the court reporters machine!!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: That was the only way I could get him to stop typing!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Hi! How are the Gellers?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Dont call us that!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: The judge wouldnt let us get an annulment! Now we gotta get a divorce!! Did a Porsch throw up on you?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Hey! Its Porsche!!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Me taking care of you is no problem, huh? You guys feel safe. Right? Okay, Im gonna take that spit bubble as, "Yeah, I do!" Okay, after I get rid of this dirty diaper Leslie, Ill set you up with a clean one.  Okay, Im sorry. I didnt mean to scare you. I just have to clean that up. Okay? Cause lets face it, were at Monicas.  I broke it. All right. Well, thats just the way that goes.  Okay, good.  Why are there only two of you? Where is Leslie? Well, you cant answer.  Leslie? Where are you Leslie? Leslie, now would be a good time for your first words!  Well, look at you! Hey! You are a little bit mischievous! My gosh!  Oh, youre a lot mischievous! Well, itll dry.   Okay, you sit with your brother and sister nowwho arent there!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Hey!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: How do you feel?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Well, lets just say that Krog will be fully equipped to destroy the universe again in twelve to fourteen hours.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Okay, so I totally took care of the babies all by myself! I fed em, bathed em, and put em to bed.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: And protected them from a tornado?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Oh my God.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: I know, the babies are asleep.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Phoebe, what, what happened here?!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: I did it! I took care of the babies all by myself!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: But my apartment!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Was the setting of Phoebes triumph.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: But the mess!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Is not as important as the fact that Phoebe took care of the babies all by herself.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Youre right, youre right I shouldnt freak out. Cause this is what will happen when you and I have babies! When will that be?!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Phoebe, would you take a look at this mess!!!!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh honey thank God youre home, I was getting worried.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: I picked up the divorce papers. Uh, Ive already signed everything and I put little Xs where you need to sign.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh, little Xs! Great! That makes up for everything!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Yknow, I-Iyouve done a lot of stupid stuff too! Okay?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh, name one stupid thing that is as stupid as this one!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Okay, how about you flew to London to stop my wedding! Ah, how about you told me you loved me after I was already married!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Hey! Wait a minute! That was different! I did those things because I was in love with you!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Yeah! Right!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Youre right. Thats very different. So lets, lets just sign the papers. All right?  What?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Nothing.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Okay, can we just sign please?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Uh-hmm.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Congratulations.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Okay Ross, werewait a minute. Umm, I uh, I kinda have a little confession.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: What?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Well, yknow this whole marriage thing, kinda my idea.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Excuse me?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Well, remember how we were too drunk to remember anything the night we were married?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Yeah?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: And uh, yeah, I didnt really, I didnt want to say anything, but it kinda it just, it kinda kept coming back to me, and umm, remember we were in the casino and for some reason thought it would be funny to eat a lot of grapes. And uh, and I thought it would be funnier if we got married. So as a, as a compromise we decided first to get married, and then  to eat a lot of grapes. So umm, sorry I got us into this mess.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: So then if-ifI mean if you think about it, this is all  your fault.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Yeah, dont push it though.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Ive got to say; I know I divorce a lot of women, never thought I would be divorcing you.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: I know. I always thought if you and I got married, it would be the one that stuck. And it wouldnt be a secret, and we wouldnt have our wedding dinner at Pizza Hut.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Did I, did I even treat?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: No, it was on the house, it was, it was a newlywed special.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: That may be the most depressing thing Ive heard in my life. I should probably get these to my lawyers office.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Hey, thanks Ross, for taking care of all of this.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Eh, no problem.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Im gonna need a copy of those.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Totally.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Hey! Hey! Be careful around my Porsche!

lines.speaker: woman
lines.text: Hi Joey.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Hey! How you doin?

lines.speaker: woman
lines.text: He has the most amazing Porsche under there!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Id love to show ya, but I just tucked her in. Shes sleeping.  Hey uh, would you two girls like to go for a drink?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Okay!  Listen, Im gonna be moving out so you will be in charge of paying the rent.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Right! And when is that due?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: First of the month.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: And thats every month?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: No, just the months you actually want to live here.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Ahhh.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Okay, here is the phone bill.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Oh my God!!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Thats our phone number. Now look, I know I kinda sprung this whole me moving out on thing, so why dont I justwhy dont I just cover you for a while?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: No-no! No way! Joey Tribbiani does not take charity anymore.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Its not charity, Joe

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: No! Forget it! OkayI mean thanks, but Im done taking money from you. All right, I can take of myself. Now, whats next? Come on.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Okay uh, heres the electric bill.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: This is how much we pay for electric?!!!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Uh, yeah.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: So, well do the rest of the bills later then?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: So is Joey going to have to give up the apartment?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: No, I hope not! I tried to offer him some money, but he wouldnt take it.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Well, how much do you think he needs?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: I figure that $1,500 would cover him for a few months, yknow? But I have to trick him into taking it so I wont hurt his pride.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Why dont you hire him as an actor? You could have him dress up and put on little skits. Whatever you want.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Well that would help the pride thing.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Hey!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Hey! Wow! You look great! Wanna move in with me tomorrow?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Okay.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Okay!  So, what do you girls have planned for tonight?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Well, instead of being sad that tonight is my last night together with Rachel we thought wed go out to dinner and celebrate the fact that Rachel is moving in with Phoebe.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: And also, my birthday.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Its not your birthday.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: What a mean thing to say! I would never tell you its not your birthday!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Hey!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Hey!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Hey!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Hey! So you guys have anything planned for the big last night?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Well, instead of just hanging out, we figure wed do nothing.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Whoa-whoa-whoa, Knicks season opener tonight. I thought maybe you guys would come over and watch it.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: I dont know Ross, not if youre gonna talk about how you gave up a career in basketball to become a paleontologist.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: I did give up a career in basketball to become a paleontologist!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Pheebs, I was wondering

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Youre not dressed yet?! Were supposed to start having fun in 15 minutes!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Well and clearly not a minute sooner.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Rachel, you are packed though right, I mean please tell me that youre packed.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Of course I packed! Monica relax! I just wanted to ask Phoebe her opinion on what I should wear tonight.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: My God, I cant get a minute of peace around this place.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Oh my God! Monicas just gonna kill you.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Yeah, yeah, I know.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Well, what youre wearing is fine for that.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Rachel, I need to borrowYoure not packed!!!! Youre not packed even a little bit!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Surprise!!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: What?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: No, no dont get mad because lookthis is what happened. So I-I started packing, then I realized, "What am I doing? I am lousy at packing!" Right? But you love packing! So, as a gift to you, on our last night, ta-da!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Ill be coordinator! Oh my God! Im so sorry, I didnt get you anything! Okay, look everybody has to help! Okay? You can help, cant you Phoebe?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: I have plans.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Youre plans were with us.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Thats right.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: All right, Chandler can make boxes, Ross can wrap, and Joey can lift things. Now Phoebe, go tell the guys they have to help out!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Okay.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Okay!  Oh my God, thank you!!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Hurry! Monicas gonna make you pack! Shes got jobs for everyone! Now, its too late for me, but save your selves!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Okay! The movers will be here in 11 hours. Rachel has not packed. Now, everybody has to help! Chandler, were gonna start with

lines.text: Oh nope, I-I have plans with Joey.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Okay fine, now Ross

lines.text: Why not?

lines.text: Ive got Ben.

lines.text: Because, because Ive got Ben.

lines.text: Its almost 8 oclock, its almost past his bedtime. Where-where is he?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Hes at a dinner party.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Is he really coming? Because I can see right into your apartment!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Of course he is! What, do you think Id just use my son as-as an excuse? What kind of father do you think I am?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: All right, sorry.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: I gotta go make a fake Ben.

lines.text: Here it is! Our last pizzas together as roommates.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Oh, I wish Id know you were going to do that, I ordered Chinese.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Oh thats okay. Hey, actually in a way its kinda nice. Me, bringing the food of my ancestors, you, the food of yours!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Say, Joe, I had a strange idea of what we could do for our last night. What do you say we play a little uh, foosball for money?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: What, are you crazy? You havent beaten me once since my injury plagued 97 season. It would be easier if you just give me your money.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Yes it would. What do you say to $50?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Okay, youre on.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Okay, lets play! The big game, Italy vs. China, apparently.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Ohhhhhh, look its the roller blades.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Oh God!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: You remember when we got these?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: No.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: I guess you werent there.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: You guys, we said we were gonna have fun! Come on, hey, remember the time  You dont remember?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Im sorry Pheebs, I guess Im just really said that Im leaving.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Im gonna miss you so much.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Well, this doesnt have to be so sad though. Yknow? Maybe instead of just thinking about how much youre gonna miss each other, you should like think of the things youre not gonna miss.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: I dont think theres anything.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Come on, theres gotta be something.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Nope, shes perfect.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: I have one.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Good! Great! You can go first.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Uh well, I guess Im not gonna miss the fact that youre never allowed to move the phone pen.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Good thats a good one. Okay, Monica, anything? Yknow? Does Rachel move the phone pen?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Aw, sometimes. Always, actually.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Okay, good. There you go. Doesnt anyone feel better?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Not just the phone pen. I never get my messages.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: You get your messages!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Yeah, well I dont think it really counts if you have to read them off the back of your hand after you fall asleep on the couch.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: So-so, you missed a message from who? Chandler or your mom? Or Chandler? Or your mom?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Great! It worked! No ones sad.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Yes! I win again! Ha-ha! Thats like 500 bucks you owe me! Whoo-ho-hoo!  $500 that is a loooot of electricity!  Whoo-ho-ho!  I gotta buy some food.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Okay, give me a chance to win my money back. Okay? Sudden death, one goal, $1,000.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: You serious?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Oh yes!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Okay, get ready to owe me!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Okay.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Okay, here we go. Ready?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: No! No! No! Noone can beat me.

lines.text: See? Now, thats why only the little fake men are supposed to do all the kicking.

lines.text: Hello?  Oh, hi Ross!  See? Other people call me!

lines.text: Ooh, your brother. Score!

lines.text: Whats up?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Oh, Im just over here with Ben. I thought wed say hi.

lines.text: Oh, put him on!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Ben, say hi to Aunt Monica.  Oh, I guess he doesnt feel like talking right now. Hes smiling though! Okay, talk to you later.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Yeah, I think it was better when you guys were sad. Hey, uh, remember the roller blades?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: You know what else Im not gonna miss? "Im Monica. I wash the toilet 17 times a day. Even if people are on it!"

lines.text: "Hi Im Rachel, is my sweater too tight? No? Oh, Id better wash it and shrink it!"

lines.text: "Oh my God, I love Ross! I hate Ross! I love Ross! I hate Ross!"

lines.text: "Oh my God, I cant find a boyfriend! So I guess Ill just stumble across the hall and sleep with the first guy I find in there!"

lines.text: Still broken?

lines.text: This sucks man! The last night youre here and I lose the two most important things in my life, the foosball table and $500.

lines.text: Well, there are other ways of winning back your money, how about a little uh, a little Blackjack?

lines.text: Cups.

lines.text: All right.

lines.text: Okay, here you go.  I have two queens, what do you have?

lines.text: Oh yeah! Okay, lets play again.  What do you got?

lines.text: Youre kidding right?

lines.text: Well thats a full cup!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Damn! I am good at Cups!

lines.text: Im not talking to her!

lines.text: Well, one of you has to take the first step! And it should be you, because shes the one whos leaving. Its harder for her!

lines.text: Well, maybe youre rightShe made fun of my phone pen!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: I know, I took it hard too.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Listen Rachel, I feel really bad aboutWhat are you doing?

lines.text: Im unpacking!

lines.text: What?!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Im not moving!  Is that picture straight?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: It needs to go about 20 blocks to the left!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Hey, yknow what? Youre the one who wants to make this big change and move in with Chandler! You should be the one to go! Why should I have to leave?!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Because its my apartment!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Well its mine too! What else you got?!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: How about, youre moving!!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Look! This is ridiculous. We should be packing you!!

lines.text: Hey, how are you guys doing?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Great! Monicas moving!

lines.text: I am not!

lines.text: Oh really?! Then how come all your stuff is in this box?!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Okay, you guys. You guys I think I know whats going on here. Okay, you guys STOP!!  I know that, I know that youre acting mad because you think that itll make it easier to leave. But deep down youre still really sad. Deep-deep down.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: No Phoebe I am mad!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Well, deep-deep-deep down!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Yeah, Im just mad!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Then keep running.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: You win.

lines.text: It doesnt matter because nothing beats a three and a six. That my friend is D-Cup. Okay, now much have you won so far?

lines.text: Uh,  wow, 700.

lines.text: Well you see in Cups, once you get $700, you have to double it.

lines.text: Hey, I didnt make up the rules. Now, after you receive the doubling bonus, you get uh, one card. Now that one card could be worth $100 bringing your total to 1,500.  Dont get to excited because thats not gonna happen unless you getNo way!

lines.text: Well, this is the last box of your clothes. Im just gonna label it, "What were you thinking?"

lines.text: What?!

lines.text: Youre just so mean to each other! And I dont want to end up like that with Rachel. I still like you!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Well, Phoebe thats fine because Im not moving.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Whoa-whoa-whoa, Phoebe you gotta take her! Yknow I-I-I said some really bad stuff about her, but yknow Rachel has some good qualities that make her a good roommate.

lines.text: Oh really? Like what Monica?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Yknow she has 147,000 pairs of boots

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh yeah, good start Mon.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: She lets you borrow them.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Yeah and you stretch em out with your big old clown feet.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Do you wanna live outside?! Because its gettin cold!  She gets tons of catalogs and umm, shell fold down the pages of the things she thinks that Id like.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: When I take a shower, she leaves me little notes on the mirror.

lines.text: Yeah, I do. I-I do, do that.

lines.text: And when I told her that I was gonna be moving in with Chandler, she was really supportive.   You were so great. You made it so easy. And now you have to leave. And I have to live with a boy!!

lines.text: Oh, its gonna be fine.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Kinda.  Oh my God!

lines.text: Hello?  Hey Mon, hows the packing going?  Ben? Hes fine. Yeah, hes rightOh my God!  Get your head of your shirt there son!  What?  Yeah, its a pumpkin. Ill come pack.

lines.text: Hey!

lines.text: Whats wrong?

lines.text: Ross and I were helping the girls pack, took a little break, I lost $1,500 to him in Cups!

lines.text: Wh-How did you lose at Cups?!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: The same way you lost. I started out with a King and a Queen, bamn! Ross gets a 2 and a 3. Then I get a Jack and a King, boom! Ross gets a 4 and a 5! Ross was getting the Cup card, the D-Cup, the Sittin Down Bonus! Meanwhile, I didnt even get half a cup! Nothin!!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Oh man!!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: And he never played before either! Yknow what I think? I think beginners luck, very important in Cups.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: All right, lets play one more hand! One more!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: No, no, no more! I cannot lose another dime! Im serious this time! In- in fact, look, theres aI wanna give you something. And let me give it too you know before I pawn it for Cups money.  Now, I want you to have the big white dog as a kinda of a, yknow, thank you for being such a great roommate.

lines.text: I cant take the big white dog! You love it!

lines.text: Its him, not it!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: No, but waitwhat if I bought it from you, yknow? And your nice gesture would be giving it to me at a reasonable price, say  $1,500?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Wait a second, I see what youre trying to do here! You-youre trying to give me money again!

lines.text: When did I try to give you money?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Over there!  Before, with the bills! You tried to give some charity, I said "No," you dropped it. Okay? Then we had a nice last night together, we had some fun, we gambled, nobody tried to give anybody any money! Now out of the blue, you start with the charity thing again!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Im just trying to help you out! Okay? I wanna make sure that youre okay.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: I will be okay! Look Chandler, you gotta get it out of your head that I cant take care of myself. Okay? Look, Im not gonna miss you helping me out with money. The only thing that Im gonna miss is you. And now the dog.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Hey. Call me when you get there. Okay?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Okay.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Im really gonna miss you.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh! I have your key. Here you go.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Thanks.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh God! This is silly, Im gonna see you in a couple of hours!

lines.text: Yeah.

lines.text: Bye Mon.

lines.text: Bye.

lines.text: Hey.

lines.text: She really left.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: I know.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.text: No problem roomie.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Can I ask you a question?

lines.text: Sure!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: What the hell is that dog doing here?!

lines.text: I invented the game of Cups as a way to give Joey money.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: And now you want that money back.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Exactly.

lines.text: Chandler, what kind of an idiot do you take me for?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Its not a real game! I made it up!

lines.text: Im sorry you lost your money, but I won it fair and square.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: At a fake game!!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Now, if you wanna try to make some of it back, Id be glad to play you for it. But I should warn you, I am very good at Cups.

lines.text: Okay! Now I assume the Saucer card came up when you played last.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: No.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Hmm, lets see if it comes up this time.

lines.text: Yeah.

lines.text: Okay.

lines.text: Hi...

lines.text: it's...

lines.text: and

lines.text: please...

lines.text: leave

lines.text: Wait, I-I just said "leave."

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Yeah, I know because you have all the good words. What do I get? I get "its," "and" oh I'm sorry, I have "A." Forget it.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Phoebe, come on that's silly.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: All right, so let's switch.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: No, I have all of the good words. OK, fine, fine, we can switch.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Okay.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Okay.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Hi

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Everybody

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: It's

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Rachel

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: and

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Phoebes

lines.text: Please...wait, how did you do that?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: What?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Oh, you're no ordinary roommate are you?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Phoebe, come on can we finish this later? Cause I wanna go running before it gets dark. Oh! Why don't you come with me?!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Really?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Yeah, it'll be fun. We'll run in the park. It'll be like our first yknow roommate bonding thing.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Okay, let's go running!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Yeah and there's really cute guys there.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Let's run towards them!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: OK!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: All right, wait just one more second. Hi, it's Phoebe and Rachel's. Please leave a message, thanks!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Now wait a minute. You just took all the words!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Uh-huh. You've met your match Rachel Green.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: So, I just finished this fascinating book. By the year 2030, there'll be computers that can carry out the same amount of functions as an actual human brain. So theoretically you could download your thoughts and memories into this computer and-and-and live forever as a machine.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: And I just realized I can sleep with my eyes open.

lines.text: Hey!

lines.text: Hey!

lines.text: Honey, that's a great idea nailing the boxes to the floor!

lines.text: I didn't nail the boxes to the floor.

lines.text: Oh, So you can move them!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Yes, and while I'm doing that, Ross has a great computer story for you.

lines.text: Hey everybody! Uh, I'd like you to meet Janine. She's-she's gonna be my new roommate!

lines.text: Hi.

lines.text: Hi!

lines.speaker: janine
lines.text: Hi

lines.text: Yeah, she's gonna live with me!

lines.text: It's nice to meet you. Janine...?

lines.speaker: janine
lines.text: Lecroix. Janine Lecroix

lines.text: So, uh, wh-where ya from?

lines.text: You're a dancer? She-she's a dancer!

lines.text: Oh, hey let me.

lines.text: Uh-huh, what exactly did you ask her?

lines.speaker: joey

lines.text: Thank you for bringing her into our lives.

lines.text: Unbelievable

lines.text: Oh, so you like her too Chandler?

lines.text: Hey, look at all the boxes!

lines.text: Wait a minute...Joey. Joey you can't ask her out, she's your roommate. It-it'll be way too complicated.

lines.text: Yeah, yeah man don't do it. I mean if you date her, then-then-then I can't date her.

lines.text: All right, think about it. Now remember when you were going out with that girl Donna and you guys broke up. Remember how horrible it was when you guys bumped into each other at the supermarket?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Okay!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: No-no

lines.speaker: joey
