lines.text: I always thought that too. Tell me, what does your father do?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Hes the headliner of a gay burlesque show.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Rach, youre killin us here, will ya serve the dessert already? Those drunken dancers are waiting!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Look at it, isnt it beautiful?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Yeah, yeah, what is it?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Its a truffle. Its got all of these layers. First theres a layer of ladyfingers, then a layer of jam, then custard, which I made from scratch,  then raspberries, more ladyfingers, then beef sauteed with peas and onions,  then a little more custard, and then bananas, and then I just put some whipped cream on top!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: W-What was the one right before bananas?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: The beef? Yeah, that was weird to me, too. But then, yknow, I thought well, theres mincemeat pie, I mean thats an English dessert, these people just put very strange things in their food, yknow.  Oh! by the way, can I borrow some Rum from your place?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Y-sure!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: And while Im gone dont you boys sneak a taste.

lines.speaker: joey and ross
lines.text: Okay.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Beef in a dessert?! I- no no no, there is no way!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: I know, and only one layer of jam?! What is up with that?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Oh my God, the pages are stuck together!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Chandler!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Oh My God, she-she made half a English Trifle, and half a...Sheperds Pie!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Oh man! Now shes gonna start all over! Were never gonna get to introduce the hot girls to the new world!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: No, no, we will. We just wont tell her she messed up.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Just let her serve the beef-custard thing?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Yeah, itll be like a funny Thanksgiving story!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Vomiting stories are funny...

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Joey, God, your apartment is like a hundred degrees!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Did-did it make you wanna walk around in your underwear?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: No!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Still not hot enough!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Rachel?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Yeah?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Okay, look at him. Look at those strong hands. Oh what I wouldnt give to be that can of  condensed milk.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Mom, uh, Chandler was just saying how beautiful your sweater is.

lines.speaker: mrs. geller
lines.text: Oh, thank you Chandler! I just bought it.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Oh, yes. Well its very beautiful. Its cream-colored and tight  I dont mean tight, I mean its not too tight, not that I was looking at-

lines.speaker: mr. geller
lines.text: Whats the matter with him?

lines.speaker: mrs. geller
lines.text: I think hes stoned again.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: What?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: What?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Dude, I need to talk to you a sec.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Okay, I think I might know why my parents dont like you.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: You do? Why?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Okay, remember, we were young. Hey, Spring break, sophomore year, I got high in my bedroom and my parents walked in and smelled it and so I told them that you had gotten stoned and jumped out the window.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: What?! Why did you do that?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: I dont know, aheh, yours was the first name that-that popped into my head, Im Im sorry. I-I didnt think it would matter.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: How could it not matter?!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: How was I supposed to know wed end up being friends after college, let alone you-you would be living with my sister?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: What about all that friends forever stuff?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: I dont know, I-I was all high.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Mom and dad just sent me in here to find out if you  were trying to get Ross stoned!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Your parents caught Ross smoking pot in college and he blamed it on me!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Ross, I cant believe youd do that!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: The reason we havent told them were together is because they hate me, okay? So will you fix this?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Okay, okay, Ill tell em it wasnt Chandler who got high. Now who should I say it was?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: You! Its not like its a big deal! You-you dont still do it or anything!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Alright, alright, now-now who should I say tricked me into doing it?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Dad, please dont pick your teeth out here! Alright, and if youre gonna put your feet up, why dont you sit on the-

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Monica, leave him alone!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Will you hurry up? Did you not hear me before when I told you that all of Janines friends are dancers?! And that theyre going to be drinking alot!?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: No, I did, but tell me again, because its so romantic.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Well youre whippin so slow! Cant you do it any faster?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Joey! Come on! I dont wanna make any mistakes, alright? This is the only dessert and if I screw it up everybody's gonna be like Oh, remember that Thanksgiving when Rachel screwed up the trifle?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: So why dont you just let me worry about making the trifle and you just worry about eating it, alright?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Oh I am!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Ross, if you dont tell them, then I will!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Okay, fine!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Ross! Can I talk to you for a second?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Oh, uh, can it wait a second Joey? I have to tell my parents something. No it cant? Okay.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Okay, look, I think we have to tell Rachel she messed up her dessert.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: What?! What is with everybody? Its Thanksgiving, not...Truth-Day!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Look, when everyone eats that...that...Banana-Meat thing, theyre all gonna make fun of her, do you want that?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Okay, okay, well just get everyone to act like they like it. That-that way noone makes fun of her and we still get to go to Sweet Potatoe Pie!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Dude, theyre not objects.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Just kiddin, Ill talk to them, you distract Rach.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Hey Rach, can I talk to you outside for a second?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Okay...

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Whats up, Ross?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: So um...Thanksgiving. The holiday season is upon us, hm?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Yeah!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: And um...You look nice today.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh no. No Ross, dont do this.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: What?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: I just- I dont think us getting back together is a good idea.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Eh?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: I thought this might happen today. Ross, I know the holidays can be rough. Yknow? And its probably really hard for you to be alone right now.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Youre alone.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: No, I-I live with Phoebe. I mean youre  alone, alone. And I just-its just not the time for us. Im sorry.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Ah well, cant blame a guy for trying!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Oh and  Okay, and uh if anyone needs help pretending to like it, I learned something in acting class, try uh, rubbing your stomach  or uh, or saying mmm and uh, oh oh! And smiling , okay?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Yeah, Im not gonna pay for those acting classes anymore.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Rachel, there you are! Come on, lets serve that dessert already!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Joey, youre gonna have to stop rushing me, you know what? You dont get any dessert.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Really?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: No, Im just kidding I would never do that to you! Okay, everybody, its trifle time!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: So, now, Rach, this is a traditional English trifle, isnt it?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: It sure is.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Wow. So then did you make it with beef or Eggplant?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Beef.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: I cant have any. You know I dont eat meat.  Ohhh no.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Alright, Monica, I want you to have the first taste.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Really?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh oh oh, wait! You only got whipped cream in there! Ya gotta take a bite with all the layers!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Okay.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Op! Wait, you dropped a pea.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Well?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Mmmm! Its good!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Really? How good?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Its so good, that I feel really selfish about being the only one whos eating it, that I think we should have everyone taste how good it is. Especially Ross.

lines.speaker: all
lines.text: Mmm.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Yeah, this is so good, that Im gonna go enjoy it on the balcony so that I can enjoy the view whilst I enjoy my dessert.

lines.speaker: mrs. geller
lines.text: Ive gotta call my friend Mary and tell her how good this is, from Monicas room.

lines.speaker: mr. geller
lines.text: Ill help you dial.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Im gonna go into the bathroom so I can look at it in the mirror, as I eat it.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Okay, now what was that all about? Is it-does it not taste good? Let me try it.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Wha? No no! Ah!   All gone! So good! Maybe Chandler has some left.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: It tastes like feet!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: I like it.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Are you kidding?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Whats not to like? Custard? Good. Jam? Good. Meat? Gooooood.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: ...So a bird just grabbed it, and then tried to fly away with it and, and then just dropped it on the street?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Yes, but if its any consolation, before the bird dropped it, he seemed to enjoy it.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Rachel, come here.  Okay, I was just starting to take my Thanksgiving nap, and I had another dream about Jack.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh, Phoebe, do I wanna hear this?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: I dunno, lets see! So, okay, I dreamt that we were gonna get married, and he left, becuz he had to go fight a fire. And, um, so okay, I went to a night club, and I saw him making out with a girl.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh my God, he dream-cheated on you!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Yeah, but then Jacques Cousteau came and he kicked his ass for betraying me! It was soo cool! Then, he took me diving and he introduced me to his pet seahorse, who, by the way, was totally coming on to me, and please, that is not gonna happen.

lines.speaker: mr. geller
lines.text: Boy, Im glad I wore the big belt today.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Five minutes ago, a line like that wouldve floored me. Now nothing. Well, not nothing, I am still a woman.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Ross? Lets go.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Oh yeah, about telling Mom and Dad, I was thinking about maybe writing a letter.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Alright, you know what? Thats it. Youve had your chance.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Wha-what?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Mom! Dad! Ross smoked pot in college!

lines.speaker: mr. and mrs. geller
lines.text: What?!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: You are such a tattletale! Mom, Dad, you remember that-that time you walked in my room and smelled marijuana?

lines.speaker: mr. and mrs. geller
lines.text: Yes.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Well I told you it was Chandler who was smoking the pot but it was me. Im sorry.

lines.speaker: mrs. geller
lines.text: It was you?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: And Dad, yknow that mailman that you got fired? He didnt steal your Playboys! Ross did!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Yeah, well, Hurricane Gloria didnt break the porch swing, Monica did!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Ross hasnt worked at the museum for a year!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Monica and Chandler are living together!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Ross married Rachel in Vegas! And got divorced! Again!!!!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: I love Jacques Cousteau!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: I wasnt supposed to put beef in the trifle!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: I wanna gooooooo!

lines.speaker: mrs. geller
lines.text: Thats alot of information to get in in thirty seconds! Alright Joey, if wanna leave, just leave. Rachel, no you werent supposed to put beef in the trifle. It did not taste good. Phoebe, Im sorry, but I think Jacques Cousteau is dead.  Monica, why you felt you had to hide the fact that you were in an important relationship is beyond me.

lines.speaker: mr. geller
lines.text: And we kinda figured about the porch swing.

lines.speaker: mrs. geller
lines.text: Ross, drugs? Divorced? Again?

lines.speaker: mr. geller
lines.text: What happened son?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: I-I uh, I got tricked into all those things!

lines.speaker: mrs. geller
lines.text: Chandler! Youve been Rosss best friend all these years, stuck by him during the drug problems.  And now youve taken on Monica as well. Well, I dont know what to say. Youre a wonderful human being.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Thank you!

lines.speaker: mr. geller
lines.text: No! Thank you!  Monica, and Ross! I dont know what Im gonna do about the two of you!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Ill talk to them!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: You guys! It was bananas, cream, and beef! I-I just cannot believe that you ate that so that I wouldnt feel bad!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Well actually, I-I didnt eat mine. Its still in the bathroom.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: No it isnt, I ate that.

lines.speaker: mrs. geller
lines.text: Well we left ours in Monicas bedroom.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Nope, got it and I got yours  too.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Let me ask you, why is everybody using these tiny lights nowadays? I remember when people used to use big lights.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Thats a good story, Grandpa.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Hey

lines.speaker: all
lines.text: Hey

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Wow, Monicas letting other people help decorate her tree! Did someone get her drunk again or?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Having a perfectly decorated tree is not what Christmas is about. Its about being with the people that you love.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: That is nice and were done. TADA!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: I dunno what it is, it just doesnt quite feel like Christmas to me.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Oh, here.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: See now it feels like Christmas!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: and thats the story of the dreidle. Now, some people trace the Christmas tree back to the Egyptians, who used to bring green palm branches into their huts on the shortest day of the year, symbolising lifes triumph over death. And that was like 4000 years ago.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: So, pretty much around the same time that you started telling this story.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Hey you guys.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Hey Joe whats up?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: I had to get out of the apartment. Janine is like stretching all over the place. Yknow, everywhere I look shes like

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: I can see why thats hard to resist.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: I like her so much!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Aw, Im sorry sweetie that she doesnt feel the same way.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: I know. And shes so sweet. I just wanna feed her grapes and brush her hair.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: You are aware that shes not a monkey, right?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: I am so over Janine. I mean, yeah, at first I thought she was hot, but now shes like OLD NEWS!

lines.speaker: janine
lines.text: Hey guys!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Hi Janine!

lines.speaker: janine
lines.text: I just got a call to be a dancer on a television special for New Years Eve. Its called some sort of Dickn Rockn Dickie Eve.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Hold it! Are you talking about Dick Clarks New Years Rocking Eve?

lines.speaker: janine
lines.text: Yeah, thats what I said.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Oh my God! We love that show! I mean Ross and I have been watching it since I can remember!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Ah, youre still just a little fat girl inside arent you?

lines.speaker: janine
lines.text: Well Im gonna be on it this year. Im gonna be one of the party people.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Youre gonna be a party person! Those guys rock the most!

lines.speaker: janine
lines.text: Well they said I should bring someone.  Do you wanna be my dance partner?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Totally! I would love to spend New Years with you.

lines.speaker: janine
lines.text: Well actually theyre taping tomorrow. I dont really understand why.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Oh, well you see how it works is, the part with Dick Clark in Times Square is actually live, but they tape some of the party stuff ahead of time. Yeah, not a lot of people know that.

lines.speaker: janine
lines.text: Yeah well, do you guys wanna come too?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Are you serious?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: We are there!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: What, what are you laughing at?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Well, I used to date him, but youre still going out with her!

lines.speaker: janine
lines.text: Thanks.  Great so we can all go together! I gotta run. Catch you later!

lines.speaker: all
lines.text: Bye!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Bye Janine!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Did she just ask me out on a date?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: I dont think so.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: What are you talking about? She just invited him to the biggest party of the millennium!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Yeah, but she also invited you and Ross. Yeah, honey, Im sorry, but I dont think that was a romantic thing.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Oh. Maybe. But hey I know how I can find out. Were going to a New Years Eve party, right? So at midnight, I can kiss her. And if she kisses me back, great! Yknow? But if she says Dude, what the hell are you doing? I can say It wasnt me, it was New Years!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Well, thats a lot better than Ross trying to kiss me in High School, and saying that he did it because he needed chapstick.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: It was a dry day.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: We are going to Dick Clarks New Years Rocking Eve!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Oh my God!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Oh my God!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Oh my God!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: OK, listen Ive been on sets before, so let me give you a little advice, alright? Its a show, but were just dancing, OK? Its no big deal. The important thing to remember  stay cool.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Got it!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Oh my God its just like I dreamed it!

lines.speaker: director
lines.text: OK, everyone gather up.

lines.speaker: monica and ross
lines.text: Scuse us

lines.speaker: director
lines.text: Heres whats gonna happen. The musics gonna start, youre gonna dance, were gonna tape, you dont look at the camera. Any questions?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Yeah, I have a question. When is this gonna air?

lines.speaker: director
lines.text: Uh, yeah. Now you guys dance over there, you guys over there, and I want you two right around here, and everyone else spread out.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Ross! So when is it gonna air?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Okay, you look in the kitchen, I will look in the back closet.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: I can save you time ladies, Im right here.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Yeah, Chandler why dont you take a walk? This doesnt concern you.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: We are looking for our Christmas presents from Monica.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: What? Thats terrible!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: No-no, we do it every year!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Oh well, that makes it not terrible.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: No, yeah, we never find them! Shes always best at us that wily minx.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Dont worry, were just gonna search here for an hour, them were gonna go over to Joeys and search, OK?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: No not okay, you cant look for Monicas presents!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: But we have to!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: No, you dont have to, and you cant because I live here too.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Well then, you should look with us.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Why?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Chandler, arent you worried about what to get Monica for Christmas?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: No, I have a great idea for a present for her.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Oh, thats it?  A great idea!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Chandler, thats not enough. I mean what if she gets you a great present, two medium presents, and a bunch of little presents? And youve just gotten her one great present? I mean thats just gonna make her feel bad. Why would you do that to her Chandler? Why? Why?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: If I help, we can find em faster!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Thats right!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Ooh ooh, we have a live one!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh, its a Macys bag!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Ooh, whos it for?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Dear losers, do you really think Id hide presents under the couch? P.S. Chandler, I knew theyd break you.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Uh-oh. She may be onto us.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: We are so gonna find them this year.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Yknow when you guys said you were gonna go across the hall and look, you dont, you dont do that every year do you?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: You dont, like go into the back of my closet, and look under my gym bag or anything?

lines.speaker: phoebe and rachel
lines.text: No, we never do that

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Because thats where Joey gave me some stuff to store that Ive never seen before in my life! Okay, that did not just happen!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Okay, here comes another camera.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Right. No biggie. Stay loose.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Why do they keep doing that?

lines.speaker: monica

lines.text: Joey! Why is Janine not coming over for dinner?!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Well uh, she didnt want to hang out with you guys two nights in a row. Im so sorry.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Well, why does she not want to hang out with us?!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Because she uh, she-she thinks that you are blah and that you, Monica, are too loud.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: What?!!  What?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: So she was just pretending to have a good time last night? She was lying to our faces?!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Ugh, I can not believe this! I mean, who is she to judge us? We could not have been nicer to her!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: And I am not blah, I am a hoot!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: I know! I know! Come on, please-please you guys, dont-dont be mad. Im sure she just, she just said that stuff because she was nervous and you guys are like my best friends! Yknow? And it was our first date! Plus, shes really sick!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: No, you shNo you said you made that up!!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: I know, but dont you think the sick thing is way better than the play thing?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Eh, theyre both good. I generally just go with, Monicas drunk again.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Come on you guys, come on please-please just give her another chance, huh? Shell come around I promise.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Of course we will, come on we gotta make dinner.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Okay.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: I do not like that woman!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: I can hear you!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: I am loud!

lines.speaker: all
lines.text: Aww!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Thats funny.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Hey Pheebs, could you please not put your feet up on my new  old sheet?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Oh sure!  Noo!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Ohh!!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: My apothecary table!!!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: What?!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Noooooo!!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Ross, where did you get this?!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: I got it at Pottery Barn!! Okay?!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh my God, Phoebe, Pottery Barn has ripped off the design of our antique!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Wow! Oh my God, well if theyve ripped off our table ours must be much more than one and fifty dollars!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh yes.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Well this doesnt even smell like opium.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Of course not, it smells like wine, which you spilled! And thanks for wrecking my sheet by the way.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Oh Ross, calm down, Ill give you the 80 cents.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Okay, one more time.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Chandler, would you like some more orange juice?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Perfect decibel.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: I know!!!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Hey!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Hey.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: So uh, what are you guys doing?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Oh nothing, were just talking. Yknow, blah-blah-blah.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Look, come on you guys, you said you were gonna try! All right look, I came over here to invite you guys to a movie with me and Janine.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Well, Id like to but,  Im not sure we have time to go.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Ha-ha, very funnyLook! I dont know what to do! I really want you guys to get along. Just please come to the movie with us. I mean you owe me!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: We owe you?!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Thats right! I helped you guys out a lot in the start of your relationship. Huh? I helped you guys sneak around for like six months, and I looked like an idiot! And I was humiliated. And I only made 200 dollars!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: We didnt give you any money!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: You dont think I know that!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: see I cant decide whether it would go better next to the new wicker dining chair, the Sahara desk, or the Parker console table.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Wow! I didnt know that there was a Pottery Barn up here.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: I know, I know. I went a little crazy.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: A little? Your place looks like page 72 of the catalogue. Oh look at that! The ornamental bird cage! Large!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Hey!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Hey.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Oh Ross no. Be careful, that is very old! Okay? Early Colonial bird merchants used to bring their birds to market in that.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Fascinating.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Another amazing find! Wow! Oh I bet this has a great story too!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh it does, it does! It is a room separating apparatus from Colonial times.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Ah!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Hmm, a lot of this stuff is from Colonial times. Hey, what are some other time periods Rachel?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Well theres yore. And uh, yknow, yesteryear.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Yeah no, Im telling you Rachel has such a great eye for this stuff. Ross, yknow if you ever decide you need to redecorateAnd I think that you should. You should, you should ask Rachel to help.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh honey he doesnt need my help.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Oh, come on! I think hes ready to get rid of, what did you call it? The cheap knock-offs and dinosaur junk.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Really?!  Hey, yknow what? Since you have such a great sense of what I need, uh ooh, heres-heres 60 bucks, why dont you take Phoebe down to that Colonial flea market of yours and get me some stuff.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Yknow what? I dont, I dont think Phoebe really wants to come.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: No! I do want to!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh, she does want to.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: She does want to.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Yeah!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Pheebs, I dont know what to say. I guess the flea market was just better last time.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Well at least I got these sheets for Ross.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Uck, look at this! Pottery Barn, yuck!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Yeah, yknow what? Dont look at it.  Seriously, dont look at it.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: No! Look-look! Theres the coffee table they stole from us!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Ugh, those bastards! Lets go.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: That fan kinda looks like ours. And the birdcage and the wait a sec! This is our exact living room!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: No! No! No! No its not! No its not! Come on! Phoebe, ours is totally different! I mean we dont have the  We dont have the that lamp! And-and that screen is yknow, on the other side.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Oh my God. This is where you got all our stuff, Pottery Barn! Oh my God!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Okay! Okay-okay lookno I did, I just wanted this stuff and I know how you feel about Pottery Barn. Just Come on dont be mad.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: No-no-no, but I am mad! I am mad! Because this stuff is everything that is wrong with the world! And its all sitting up in my living room and all I can think about is how I dont have that lamp!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Well then honey, buy the lamp! Hey, we have that 60 bucks from Ross.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: I cant! I cant! Unless Well are you saying that-that you would move out if-if I didnt buy that lamp?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: What?! No! Im not gonna move out!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: But are you saying that you would move out if I didnt buy that lamp?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh. Yes! I would so move out!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Okay then I dont have a choice! I have to buy that lamp!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Thats right!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: But at least the apothecary table is real.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Well, this-this-this was great. Didnt everybody have a great time?

lines.speaker: janine
lines.text: Well I did. I really did. And you guys, Ive got to say, Im sorry if I was a little weird after the last time we went out. I guess I was just nervous or something.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Thats totally understandable.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Dont worry about it.

lines.speaker: janine
lines.text: So we can go out again?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Oh yeah!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Absolutely!

lines.speaker: janine
lines.text: Oh good.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Oh well then, good night!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Good night!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: See? Eh, wasnt that fun?

lines.speaker: janine
lines.text: We have got to move!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: I knew it!! Yknow, youre not so quiet yourself, missy!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: And Im blah? Listen, the only thing more boring than watching modern dance is having to listen to you talk about it,  "Oh Chandler, I just lost myself in the moment."

lines.speaker: janine
lines.text: Yknow, I know youre talking, but all I hear is, "Blah. Blah. Blah- blah-blah."

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: All right! You and me! Lets go! Right now!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: All right! All right! Enough! Enough! Enough!! Enough!  You two go home! I-I-I gotta talk to Janine!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Yknow I think you can take her.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Youd better hope I dont see you in the hallway!!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: All right, uh, weve got a little bit of a problem here. These people are my friends; you cant treat them that way.

lines.speaker: janine
lines.text: They said stuff to me too, yknow!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: I know! I know! And Im going to talk to them about it. They mean so much to me. They Theyre like my family. If you guys are gonna be fighting all the time, I-I I dont think we can be together. It just, it just cant work. It cant.  Im very upset.

lines.speaker: janine
lines.text: Okay. Okay. Would, would it help if I went over and apologized?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Yeah! Yeah! That would be very helpful! Yeah.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: What did I tell you about the hall?!

lines.speaker: janine
lines.text: I was just coming over here to apologize for my behavior! Id really like it if we could be friends.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Well, I know that would make Joey happy, so, I would like that too.

lines.speaker: janine
lines.text: Great.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Now come on.  Well, Im glad we worked things out.

lines.speaker: janine
lines.text: Me too.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Okay.

lines.speaker: janine
lines.text: Ill see you.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Bye.

lines.speaker: janine
lines.text: Or Ill hear you.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Thats it big girl!  Come on!

lines.speaker: janine
lines.text: Wait!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Youd better run!

lines.text: Did you hear that?

lines.text: Yeah uh, what am I gonna do?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Yeah, Im sorry man.  You wanna go watch?

lines.text: Yeah!

lines.text: Hey!

lines.text: How ya doin?

lines.text: Hey so, did uh, did she move out?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Pretty much, yeah.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: I cannot believe you broke up with her just like that.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Well, when its not right, you know it.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: You okay?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Yeah! Yeah. Ill be all right.

lines.text: Yknow what would cheer you up?

lines.text: What?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Im giving this lecture on erosion theories tomorrow night, I think you should come.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Youre right! That did cheer me up!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Hey, youre not going to believe this. I made up a joke and sent it in to Playboy. They printed it!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: I didnt know Playboy prints jokes.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Yeah, they print jokes, interviews, hard-hitting journalism. Its not just about the pictures.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: That didnt work on mom, its not going to work on us.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Here, check it out. Its the first one, too.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: That is funny. It was also funny when I made it up.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: What?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: I made that joke up.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Uh, oh-oh, no you didnt. I did.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Yes, I did. I told it to Dan at work, and he said it was the funniest joke hed ever heard.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Hey, tell Dan, Thanks.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: What?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Im sorry, I was just reading the joke below it. Man, that one is funny.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Monica, you remember me telling you that joke, right?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: No.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Seriously?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Well, you tell a lot of jokes!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Look, Chandler, its my joke. But, hey, if it makes you feel any better they dont print the name, so it doesnt really matter who gets credit, right?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Yeah, I guess.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Hey guys.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Hey, Joey, Playboy printed my joke.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: No, its my joke, its mine. You can call them, theyll tell you.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Its my joke.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Its my joke.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Whoa-whoa-whoa. Jokes? You guys know they have naked chicks in there, right?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Dude, you have got to turn on Behind the Music. The band Heart is having a really tough time, and I think they may break up.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Lets go watch it at your place.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Nah, Monicas watching some cooking show. Come on, I dont want to miss when they were skinny.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Chandler, Chandler, yknow what we should do? You and I should go out and get some new sunglasses.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: What? No, I want to watch this. . Did your cable go out?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: No, thats VH-1. I gotta tell you, the music these kids listen to today . . . Its like a lotta noise to me. I dont know

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Joey, why is your cable out?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: I uh, oh! Because, uh, I havent really paid the bill

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: If you need money, will you please-please just let me loan you some money?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: No, Chandler. Look, forget about it, okay? Look, I know things have been a little tight since Janine moved out. Oh, was she hot.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Whoa ho.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: I know! Yeah, but, look I can handle it. All right? Look, I can listen to the radio, huh? And Ross gave me this great book .

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: All right, you want to see if the joke stealer will let us watch the show at his place?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Sure.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Paid your phone bill?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Not so much.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Hey.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Its only you.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Wh-wh-what are you doing?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: We are looking at a Playboy.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Oh, I want to look too! . Yikes!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: So do you think that these picturesAre, are they trying to tell a story?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh, yeah, sure. I mean, like in the case of this young woman, she has lost her clothes, so she rides naked on the horse, shes crying out, Where are they, where are they?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Well, shes not going to find them lying in the grass like that.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Oh, yeah. Aw, remember the days when you used to go out to the barn, lift up your shirt, and bend over?

lines.speaker: rachel and monica
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: You see, now, I would date this girl. Shes cute, shes outdoorsy, you know, and she knows how to build a fire. I mean, thats got to come in handy

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Okay, Ive got a question. If you had to pick one of us to date, who would it be?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: I dont know.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Me neither.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Rachel.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: What?!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: I dont know.  Me neither.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: You forget how many great songs Heart had.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: You know, Barracuda was the first song I learned to play on the keyboard.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: So, you heard it, you repeated it, so that must mean you wrote it.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Oh, you guys, with this joke. I gotta say, I know I cracked up, but Im not even sure I got it.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: What, you didnt get it? The doctor is a monkey.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: And monkeys cant write out prescriptions.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: You are not allowed to laugh at my joke.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Your joke? Well, I think the Hef would disagree, which is why he sent me a check for one hundred ah-dollars.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: So, you stole my joke, and you stole my money.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Well, I was going to stick it in the ATM, but now I think Ill show the sexy teller that I am a published writer.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Well, she is going to know that you stole the joke.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Oh, what are you going to do, follow me down there?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Yeah!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Well, Im not going to go now anyway .

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Okay .

lines.speaker: gunther
lines.text: Here you go.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Ah, Gunther, I cant pay for this right now because Im not working, so Ive had to cut down on some luxuries like uh, payin for stuff.

lines.speaker: gunther
lines.text: Well, if you want, you can work here.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Uh, I dont know. Ya see, its just, see I was a regular on a soap opera yknow? And to go from that to this, I just Plus, Id have to wait on all my friends.

lines.speaker: gunther
lines.text: Okay, but the moneys good, plus you get to stare at Rachel as much as you want.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: What?!

lines.speaker: gunther
lines.text: Flexible hours.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Maybe I could be a waiter. Could I use the phone?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: She picked Rachel. I mean, she tried to back out of it, but it was obvious. She picked Rachel.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: He took my joke, he took it.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Its wrong. You know what else is wrong? Phoebe picking Rachel.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: You know who else picked Rachel? Ross, and you know what else Ross did? He stole my joke. You know what? Im going to get a joke journal. Yknow? And document the date and time of every single one of my jokes.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Thats a good idea.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Yeah!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Do you know whats a bad idea?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Picking Rachel.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Thats right.  Did you hear something?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Maybe its the sound of Ross climbing into my brain and stealing my thoughts.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Its coming from the living room.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: I finished my book.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Hey, you guys.

lines.speaker: phoebe and rachel
lines.text: Hey.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Oh, dont you guys look cute. You guys make such a cute couple.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Monica, what are you doing?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Nothing, Im just trying to recreate some of the fun that we had at my place the other day.  Remember, when you picked Rachel over me? That was funny.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: I guess it was kinda funny.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: It wasnt funny at all! Why would you do that? Why didnt you pick me?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Fine. The reason that I was leaning a little bit more toward Rachel than you is just that youre  just  kinda high maintenanceOkay lets go to lunch!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: That is completely untrue. You think Im high maintenance? Okay, prove it. I want you to make a list and were going to go through it point by point!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: No, okay, youre right. Youre easy-going. Youre just not as easy- going as Rachel. Shes just more flexible and-and mellow. Thats all.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Well, people are different.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Ya, you know, Rachel  shell do whatever you want. Yknow, you can just walk all over her.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: What? Wait a minute. What are you saying, that Im a pushover? Im not a pushover.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Oh, okay,  youre not a pushover.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh my  you think Im a pushover. Well wait, watch this, you know what? Youre not invited to lunch. What do you think of that? I think thats pretty strong, thats what I think. Come on, Monica, lets go to lunch.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: You start working on that list.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: I cannot believe her.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: I know. Where do you wanna go eat?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh, oh, I love that Japanese place.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Im sick of Japanese. Were not going there.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: All right, wherever you wanna go is cool.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: All right.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Oh, hey, Gunther, check this out.

lines.speaker: gunther
lines.text: Yeah, that-that Chandler cracks me up.

lines.speaker: joey

I still got it. Nice and sexy. Youre just a love machine.  Im just a love machine and I wont work for nobody but you! Hey bab-y!  Showtime.  Im just a love machine, yeah ba-by!
